name: overdrive
description: Bash script to download mp3s from the OverDrive audiobook service

repo.name: overdrive
repo.description: Fka. Bash script to download mp3s from the OverDrive audiobook service

readme.summary: The README is essentially a deprecation notice with no documentation of what the package does, how to install it, or how to use it.
readme.top_issue: Complete absence of documentation - the README only states the project is dead and provides no information about functionality, installation, or usage.

injection_risks.description: The curl command is constructed with user-controlled input (AcquisitionUrl, MediaID, ClientID) without proper sanitization or validation.
The sed command uses unescaped & characters which could potentially lead to injection attacks if the input is not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Potential injection risks in curl command construction
Lack of input validation for user-provided media files and commands
security.summary: The overdrive.sh script has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be a well-structured and secure script.

common_complaints: Platform discontinued OverDrive desktop app support (Nov 2024)
ODM download paths no longer work due to platform changes
Download options being removed from OverDrive interface
praise_themes: Helped users migrate from Windows to Linux
sentiment.summary: The project is effectively defunct due to OverDrive platform discontinuation, with users expressing frustration about the tool's incompatibility with current OverDrive infrastructure and no apparent maintainer engagement to address fundamental viability issues.

red_flags: Occasional dismissive tone towards certain contributions
Acknowledgment of the project's obsolescence without providing alternatives
communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with contributors. However, there is a lack of depth in technical explanations and occasional dismissiveness.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from May 2025
No active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating no bug fixes or maintenance
Unknown last release date suggests potential versioning issues
Complete lack of development activity over extended period
positive_signals: Zero open issues suggests no reported problems or user engagement
Zero open PRs indicates no pending work or community contributions
maintenance.summary: The overdrive package appears abandoned with no development activity, commits, or issue resolution for at least 6 months.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README is outdated and does not provide any useful information for new users.
concerns: Docs: The package is declared dead and there are no instructions or examples provided for its usage.
Community: ODM download path no longer supported
Community: Audiobook 'Borrow' button modal omits Download option
Communication: Occasional dismissive tone towards certain contributions
Communication: Acknowledgment of the project's obsolescence without providing alternatives
Security: Potential injection risks in curl command construction
Security: Lack of input validation for user-provided media files and commands
High bus factor risk (95% from top contributor)
